New Records: Devon Conway scored the fastest 50-overs World Cup century by a New Zealander, bringing his up in just 83 balls
Rachin Ravindra became the youngest centurion in a global tournament at 23
Key Match Events: Sam Curran snared Will Young down the leg side for a first-ball duck
Devon Conway smashed Chris Woakes for 20, starting with a six heaved over wide long-on before a brace of fours
Rachin Ravindra's shotmaking was crisp, notably when crunching a flat six over square leg from a Mark Wood delivery that registered 148kph, bringing up the team fifty in just 6.5 overs
Moeen Ali, sent in at No.5, had his stumps rearranged by part-time offspin
Root attempted a reverse paddle and was dismissed, the first boundary being the most bombastic - the patented reverse-lap skying Boult over the keeper for six
Post-Match Reflections: England's efforts with the bat had various jumping-off points for a score greater than the 282 for 9 they managed from 50 overs
The half-century came from 57 deliveries, a return to form for a player who just last month averaged 9.75 at home against the same opponents across a four-match series
This was a defeat with flashes of those dark ages, referring to the team's past struggles
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand won by 9 wickets (with 82 balls remaining)
Conway and Ravindra put on an unbroken 273-run stand, the highest partnership in the tournament's history
Santner led the slower bowlers, tempting Bairstow into going over the top of cover only to misdirect a lofted drive to Daryl Mitchell at long-off
Glenn Phillips removed two batters in the first seven balls of three overs
